So said  Michael Rettig  on  2002-11-14 

>----- Original Message -----
>From: Steven Taschuk <staschuk@...>
>> Does there exist a JDBC driver for a transient in-memory store?
>> I'd like to use such a thing as a mock database for testing that
>> code makes proper use of JDBC.  Testing such things as:
>>   - Proper use of JDBC escapes (exposed when the driver uses some
weird
>>     syntax for various kinds of literals).
>>   - Adaptation to (or graceful failure in) the absence of certain
SQL
>>     features.
>>   - Graceful failure in the case of violation of data constraints.
>> 
>
>I use Hypersonic. It works beautifully. It can also be configured to
use
>files, memory, or as  a real server. 
>
>http://sourceforge.net/projects/hsqldb/

I had been wary of this product, because it looked like it wasn't ready
for prime time. If you say it's good, then I should take another look.

J. B. Rainsberger,
